DOC.brief_summary: Five high methylglyoxal (460-667 mg/kg) Manuka honey samples were selected from different geographical locales around the North Island of New Zealand and tested for glycaemic index (GI) in 10 healthy volunteers in a single-blinded, randomised study. Participants were fed honey containing 25g of available carbohydrate in 200 ml water and the blood glucose responses measured (area under the curve; AUC) and compared to that of 25 g of available carbohydrate from glucose.
DOC.brief_title: The Glycaemic Index of Manuka Honey
DOC.criteria: healthy (Body mass index (BMI) 2025) nonsmoking aged between 1845 years absence of diabetes or chronic illness not taking any medications. currently dieting suffering from illness or chronic disease currently taking medication smokers (including recreational) outside healthy BMI range
